titleStmt.title: Missa triumphans, or, The triumph of the mass wherein all the sophistical and wily arguments of Mr de Rodon against that thrice venerable sacrifice in his funestuous tract by him called, The funeral of the Mass, are fully, formally, and clearly answered : together with an appendix by way of answer to the translators preface / by F.P.M.O.P. Hib.
titleStmt.author: Collins, William, 17th cent.

titleStmt.title: Missa triumphans, or, The triumph of the mass wherein all the sophistical and wily arguments of Mr de Rodon against that thrice venerable sacrifice in his funestuous tract by him called, The funeral of the Mass, are fully, formally, and clearly answered : together with an appendix by way of answer to the translators preface / by F.P.M.O.P. Hib.
titleStmt.author: Collins, William, 17th cent.
F. P. M. O. P.

notesStmt.note: Attributed to William Collins. Cf. NUC pre-1956.
Pages 239-240 of pt. 1, and p. 40-41 of pt. 2 have print missing in filmed copy; p. 220-253 of pt. 1 and p. 30-48 of pt. 2 photographed from Bodleian Library copy and inserted at the end.
Identified on film as Wing C5389.
Reproduction of original in Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
